H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5592.def: = receptacle of undetermined size; ◄ made out of metal; ► used both for household and religious purposes

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

131.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4614.def: = heavy stone ► possibly used in weightlifting exercises{N:001} or to barricade a road{N:002}

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H7697.def: = state of being (considered) out of one's mind; ≈ often used as an insult, especially of prophets

H6491.def: literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H556.def: = state in which humans have physical, political, and/or military strength

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H3940.def: = piece of wood burning on one end; ► used to provide light or as a means of igniting something else; ≈ associated with light and destruction

H5995.def: = harvested grain, whether bundled in sheaves or not

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H8045.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H8469.def: = to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1856.def: = causative action by which humans thrust violently against other humans with a sharp weapon, ► with the aim of wounding them or ending their lives

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H3173.def: = state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community

H4843.def: = state in which a liquid has a sharp, pungent taste; ≈ regarded as unpleasant and unsuitable for consumption; associated with anger and grief

H1060.def: = first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H1910.def: = deity; ◄ worshipped by Arameans; ► whose death was ritually mourned by his followers

H1237.def: = a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

H4023.def: = town; ◄ located to the southwest of Valley of {L:Jizreel<SDBH:יִזְרְעֶאל>}, territory of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► former {L:Canaanite<SDBH:כְּנַעֲנִי>} kingdom; location where king {L:Josiah<SDBH:יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ>} of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>} was killed during his battle with Pharaoh {L:Neco<SDBH:נְכֹה>}
